speaker: Frasier
text: Cranberry muffin, please.  And, uh... a vanilla latte.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, dear, comfort food.  What happened?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles?  Do you think I'm elitist?

speaker: Niles
text: Of course I do.  You needn't worry about that.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, not in the good way.  At work today, I discovered an injurious graffito about me.  Scrawled on the men's room wall.

speaker: Niles
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Quote: There once was a man, Frasier Crane, Who says he can feel your pain. But he acts like a snob, To the guys at his job, And I think he's totally lame.

speaker: Niles
text: That's terrible!  There's a tense shift, an approximate rhyme, the scansion leaves a lot to be desired...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you're missing the point!  I have always striven to be approachable, the embodiment of the words "If you can talk with crowds and keep your virtue..."

speaker: Niles
text: "Or walk with kings, nor lose the common touch."

speaker: Frasier
text: Exactly!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  If maligner truly knew who I was, he'd have found that a more apt characterization than "snob."

speaker: Niles
text: Assuming he's familiar with Kipling.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are the odds? _Roz stops in the doorway to kiss her boyfriend goodbye before he heads off._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Roz.  I'd ask you to join us, but I see you've already had happy hour.  Well, here, please, join us.

speaker: Frasier
text: So?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, his name is Roger, and we've been kinda goin' out for the last couple of weeks.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, tell us about him.

speaker: Roz
text: He's very sweet - and he's a garbage man, so go ahead and make your jokes.

speaker: Frasier
text: What jokes?  Why does everyone assume I look down on the common man?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I've got a good one: So, even in his off time, he's taking out the trash.

speaker: Frasier
text: Technically, that's really more about Roz.  Now if I were to make a joke about him, which of course I wouldn't, I'd say he has a thing for Roz's can.

speaker: Roz
text: You two finished?

speaker: Roz
text: And don't worry, I won't get dumped.

speaker: Niles
text: I'd already passed on that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's a bit on the nose.  **HE KICKED SPASSKY'S BUTT IN REYKJAVIK**  _Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment  Fade in.  Daphne and Martin are in the living room, going through boxes.  Niles comes in the front door._

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey. [_she holds up a photo_] Look what your father found: a picture of you in a teddy bear costume.

speaker: Niles
text: Why do you have all this out?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I was makin' room in the storage closet and I found some of your old stuff.

speaker: Niles
text: What else is in here?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, here's your cap and your blazer from Bryce academy.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I bet you were the cutest thing in that.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, here's a picture of me in it.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_a bit flat_] Oh.

speaker: Niles
text: [_picking up a plaque_] Oh, oh, oh, oh.  Bobby Fisher's autograph.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, son, it's been enough years, I can probably tell you the truth about that.

speaker: Niles
text: [_holding the plaque to his chest proudly_] What?

speaker: Martin
text: [_covering_] Oh, look!  A picture of you in your first little league uniform. [_wistfully_] Don't know why I said "first."

speaker: Daphne
text: [_taking it_] Was that your game face?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, no.  I'd just lost a tooth to an errant pitch.

speaker: Martin
text: Tell her who was pitchin'.

speaker: Niles
text: I was. _Daphne puts her arm around him to comfort him and kisses his cheek. FADE OUT.  Scene 3 - KACL  Fade in.  Frasier is sitting at his desk, Roz comes in with a bouquet._

speaker: Frasier
text: Flowers from your new beau?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Must be nice to be liked.

speaker: Roz
text: [_coming back_] Are you still obsessing over that limerick?

speaker: Frasier
text: People are making additions.  Good lord, I've read anthologies with fewer contributing authors.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm sure they'll all wash right off.

speaker: Frasier
text: If only there were a solvent that could remove the stains they've left on my spirit.

speaker: Roz
text: It was a joke.  What's the big deal?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_following_] Oh, yes, I know.  Being written up on the bathroom wall is no big deal to you.  But that limerick made a point, as all good limericks do.   It seems to have resonated with everyone around here.  I want these people to know the real Frasier Crane.

speaker: Roz
text: Wouldn't it be better if you tried to make them like you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  And to that end I was thinking along the lines of... oh, say a little party.  For the entire staff, at my place.  Hey, you could bring Roger!

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks.  But I think it's a little too soon.  I don't want to put any pressure on him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, Roz.  You're always saying you don't have a date for these things.

speaker: Roz
text: There's gonna be a lotta radio talk, and I'm not sure he's gonna be that comfortable with this crowd.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who is?  Come on, Roz, I'd like to meet him.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know.  Maybe next party.

speaker: Frasier
text: Does this have anything to do with his occupation, you know, his being a refuse collector?

speaker: Roz
text: No, I am completely comfortable with his job.  I just don't want him to feel awkward around other people.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.

speaker: Roz
text: Not that he should.  Or would.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all right, fine, fine.  If you change your mind, he's more than welcome.  It promises to be a real wing-ding.  If being a snob is the reputation I've built around here, then this party will be the wrecking ball of congeniality that tears it down.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, say stuff like that. _Getting her point, he smirks and heads back to his side.  FADE OUT.  Scene 4 - Roz's Apartment  Fade in.  Roger comes in the front, carrying Alice and roller blades._ [_N.B. The first appearance of Ashley Thomas as Alice May Doyle._]

speaker: Roger
text: Say "Come on, Mom."

speaker: Alice
text: Come on, Mom.

speaker: Roger
text: Say "Don't be a wuss."

speaker: Alice
text: Don't be a wuss.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm not a wuss.

speaker: Roger
text: Ohh, I know you said you were gonna make dinner, but why not just open a can of something?

speaker: Roz
text: How'd you think I was gonna make dinner?  Alice, go pick out some PJs.

speaker: Roger
text: [_pulling a book from his backpack_] When you're ready, I've got a special book for you.  It's called "Make Room for Monkeys." Now hurry up, get outta here, go on.

speaker: Roz
text: "Make Room for Monkeys"?  Where did you find this?  You know it's out of print.

speaker: Roger
text: Yeah, well, a certain very bad skater told me it was her favorite book when she was growing up, so I kept my eyes open and I found it in a pile of old books.

speaker: Roz
text: [_nervously_] You mean like at the dump?

speaker: Roger
text: No, not a dump!  Please, it's a secret underground landfill accessible only to garbage men.  And the Mole People who live there.  I used to be one of them, but then I decided to join the surface dwellers and find my queen.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.  That's very thoughtful.

speaker: Roger
text: And you will make an excellent Mole Queen.  Of course, after a year underground, your eyes will fuse shut.  Your sense of smell will stick around...

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, stop, stop, stop.  Do you joke around about your career because you're uncomfortable talking about it?

speaker: Roger
text: You mean deeply and utterly ashamed?

speaker: Roz
text: Whatever, your words.

speaker: Roger
text: I don't know, I've never really thought about it as a career. I mean, it's just a job to me.  You know, it's got great benefits, and afternoons off and... when I have a family, I'll get to spend a lot of time with them.  How sweet will that be?

speaker: Roz
text: Would you like to go to a party with me on Saturday?

speaker: Roger
text: I'd love to.  I found a great pair of shoes this morning. They damn near match. _She slaps him playfully and leans back against him.  FADE OUT.  Scene 5 - Frasier's Apartment  Fade in.  The staff of KACL is at the party and Frasier is greeting newcomers at the door._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good to see you, glad you could come, make yourselves at home.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras, why don't you introduce me some of your friends?

speaker: Frasier
text: I wish I could, Dad.  I don't know any of these people myself.

speaker: Martin
text: You don't?  I better go hide my beer in the crisper.

speaker: Jason
text: Hey, Frasier, thanks for inviting me to your party.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's my pleasure... man.

speaker: Jason
text: Did you see the game today?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, I did not.

speaker: Jason
text: Aw, man, it was a real squeaker.  U-Dub pulled it out at the end with a last minute field goal.  It's all about special teams, am I right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, right.  You know, I think they prefer the term "challenged."

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, Roz!    Come on in, Good to see you.  And you must be Roger.

speaker: Roger
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lovely to meet you.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Jason.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Jason, this is Roger.  Yeah, the ol' J-man here and I were just shootin' the breeze, ya know.  This guy.  Okay, so enjoy yourself there. [_He turns to Roz as Jason heads away._] So, Roz um... Roger, do you suppose I could borrow Roz for just one minute?

speaker: Roger
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you so much.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, please, don't leave me alone here, I don't know any of these people's names.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, I can't leave Roger alone in a room full of nosey strangers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, look, look, he's already met Dad.  He knows as many people as I do.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm sorry.  You're gonna have to find yourself another patsy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well where the hell am I supposed to find another... [_noticing_] ...Kenny! _CUT TO: Roz as she walks by Martin's chair.  Noel is sitting in it and gets up._

speaker: Noel
text: Hey Roz!  Lookin' su-weet!

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Noel.

speaker: Noel
text: So, that's the competition?  Or, are you just using him to make me jealous?

speaker: Roz
text: Actually, I forgot you were gonna be here.

speaker: Noel
text: I'll bet you regret bringing the arm candy now.  So, uh, what's he do?

speaker: Roz
text: He... works for the city.

speaker: Noel
text: So, in a manner of speaking, I pay his salary.  Which makes me his boss.  Does that turn you on?

speaker: Roz
text: Roger, would you like something to drink?

speaker: Roger
text: Yeah, I'll come with you.  Nice meeting you, Martin. _They head for the drinks table and meet up with another worker, Cheryl._

speaker: Cheryl
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Cheryl.

speaker: Cheryl
text: Introduce me to your friend.

speaker: Roz
text: Roger, this is Cheryl.

speaker: Roger
text: Hey, Cheryl, how you doing?

speaker: Cheryl
text: Hi, nice to meet you.  I think I know you from somewhere.

speaker: Roger
text: Yeah?  Maybe I work in your neighborhood.

speaker: Cheryl
text: Oh, what do you do?

speaker: Roz
text: What doesn't he do?  He sends me flowers and gives me massages and he's just great.

speaker: Cheryl
text: Really?   You know she has a kid, right?

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, Cheryl!

speaker: Roger
text: So, uh, why didn't you tell her what I do?

speaker: Roz
text: And have her stalking you at work?  I don't think so. _CUT TO: Frasier talking to some guests, Dennis and Emily.  Emily is a bit overweight.  Kenny is behind him, whispering names._

speaker: Dennis
text: Great party, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks.  Glad you could come...

speaker: Kenny
text: Dennis.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dennis.  You too...

speaker: Kenny
text: Emily.

speaker: Frasier
text: Emily.  Say, when are you expecting?

speaker: Kenny
text: NNNOOO!

speaker: Frasier
text: ...this weather to change?

speaker: Noel
text: Well, you're not the first rustler who's tried to cut my filly from the herd. _Roger looks very confused.  CUT TO: Frasier talking to Dennis and Emily._

speaker: Frasier
text: So, did you guys happen to see the game today?

speaker: Dennis
text: No, I missed that.  Who won?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, it was a real squeaker.  U-Dub pulled it out at the last second with a real clutch field goal.  Say Dad, what's goin' on?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know.

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah, the station manager's sort of the head honcho.  You know, the go-to guy.  You could replace virtually everybody at the station except for me. [_he notices Roz behind him_] And Roz! So, uh, what do you do?

speaker: Roger
text: I'm a...

speaker: Roz
text: Roger, could you please get me a sandwich?

speaker: Roger
text: Yeah, okay.

speaker: Kenny
text: So I take it handsome's not in the biz, huh?  So, what's he do?

speaker: Roz
text: What difference does it make Kenny?  Why are people so obsessed with what you do?  Every party you ever go to, all anyone ever asks you is "What do you do?" "What do you do?"

speaker: Roz
text: You know, not everyone has a job they're proud of, did you ever think of that?  Why can't you ask him about music or sports or books, for God's sake.  "Have you read a good book, lately?" Why don't you ask him that instead of embarrassing everybody.

speaker: Roger
text: Here's your sandwich, Roz.

speaker: Kenny
text: So, have you read any good books lately?

speaker: Roger
text: No, actually, us garbage men don't have a lot of time to read books.  We've gotta get up pretty early in the morning, so I guess I'd better get out of here.  Bye, Roz.

speaker: Roger
text: Hey, Frasier, thanks a lot.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Roger
text: It was really nice meeting everyone.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_calling_] Goodbye.

speaker: Kenny
text: [_whispering_] Roger!

speaker: Frasier
text: I know that. _FADE OUT.  End of Act 1  Act 2_ **LOVE STINKS** _Scene 1 - KACL  Fade in.  Roz is at her desk, Frasier in the hallway behind her._

speaker: Dennis
text: Hey!  Crane man!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dennis, Lisa.  Hi.  Patty, lookin' good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Kill me.

speaker: Roz
text: What are you talking about?  You're Mr. Popularity.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  And it's a living hell.  I have spent the entire morning exchanging fake pleasantries with a bunch of people that I have absolutely nothing in common with.  I miss being unapproachable.

speaker: Roz
text: I thought you wanted to be loved by the common man.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but couldn't they have sent just one representative? _He heads for his side of the booth.  Roz follows, but stops to stare out the window at a janitor emptying a waste basket._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: I'm sorry.  Ever since Roger and I broke up, I can't look at trash the same way.

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you want to talk about it?

speaker: Roz
text: No, it's okay.  It's just so weird.  You go through life meeting people who are all the same, you know.  And they just think you're the same, too.  And then one day, you meet this guy, but he's not the same, because he actually sees that you're not the same.  And he knows, because he's the same way.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, sounds to me like you're in love.

speaker: Roz
text: I can't be.  I know this is shallow and I hate myself for it, but I can't be in love with a garbage man.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then, you need to move on and realize that you've learned something about yourself.

speaker: Roz
text: Great.  I learned that I'm a snob.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  Just that you have certain standards that it may be difficult for others to live up to.  You know, Roz, it seems you and I are more alike than we thought.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, now I'm really miserable.  Look at me, I'm a mess.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, tell you what, we've got a few minutes before the show starts, just go clean yourself up.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay.  Thanks.

speaker: Jason
text: Hey, hey.

speaker: Noel
text: Dr. Crane, what's goin' on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, my show, actually, in about two minutes.  What can I do for you gentlemen?

speaker: Jason
text: Sue invited us all over to watch the fight on pay per view.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Well, as tempting as that sounds, I'm going to have to decline.

speaker: Jason
text: Okay, we'll catch you next time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, you won't.  Jason, Noel... you there.  I've been living a lie.  Let me tell you a little something about a few things I don't like: Boxing for one.  Sporting events of any kind.  Barbecues, office parties, buddy movies.  Any dish made with marshmallows.  Things that I DO like: the opera, the symphony, Elizabethan revenge dramas et cetera. So, if you're not inclined toward any of these interests, well, then, our association can be civil at best.  Are we all clear on this concept?

speaker: Noel
text: I told you. _The three leave the booth, muttering.  Frasier sits at his desk with a self-satisfied look.  FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment  Daphne is going through some boxes again and Martin is reading the paper.  Niles comes in._

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, what's going on?

speaker: Daphne
text: I found another box of pictures from your childhood.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, look at this one, you're adorable.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, it's all adorable.   My retainer and the membership card to the young magician's club and that picture of me in my choo-choo jammies.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, with your caboose hangin' out.

speaker: Daphne
text: Adorable.

speaker: Niles
text: Can we just give my childhood a rest for a while?  I mean, how would you feel if I took your most humiliating moments and put them on display?

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, I think I've got the perfect picture frame for this one.

speaker: Martin
text: So she puts a few pictures out, what's the big deal?  There's a whole part of your life she missed out on.

speaker: Niles
text: I guess.

speaker: Martin
text: Besides, I like seein' your old stuff.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, no one around here draws pictures any more.  What the hell is this supposed to be, anyway?

speaker: Niles
text: [_coming over to him_] Oh!  That is an Egyptian battle scene from "Aida."  That's Radames and that's the jealous Amneris... Oh, I misspelled "Amonasro."  Oh, to be six again. _Martin gets up and heads for the kitchen as Daphne returns carrying a box._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, what is that?

speaker: Daphne
text: Some things from my childhood.  You asked how I'd feel if the shoe was on the other foot, go ahead, take a look.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay.  Ooh, well, that's a wonderful drawing of a... uh... turtle.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, that's me Dad crawling home from the pub.

speaker: Niles
text: Well why did you sign it "Dappy"?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, me Mum did that.  My family called me "Dappy" because I couldn't say "Daphne."

speaker: Niles
text: Really?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, I hated it.  My brothers would sing "Dappy, Dappy, wet her nappy."

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I think it's precious... Dappy.  I'm gonna call you that from now on... Dappy.

speaker: Daphne
text: No you won't.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, how about I call you "Dappy" until you put my mementos back in the box.  How does that sound, Dappy?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, that's not fair.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Dad. [_Martin comes back in with a beer._] You'll never guess what silly nickname Daphne was called as a child.

speaker: Martin
text: [_heading for his room_] Was it worse than "Piles"?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, that can't bring up fond memories. _FADE OUT.  Scene 3 - Roz's Apartment  Fade in.  Roz is working with a cleaning lady, Alice is sitting on the couch reading "Make Room for Monkeys."  There is the sound of a truck outside._

speaker: Alice
text: Roger's here.

speaker: Alice
text: Let's go see him.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't think so, sweety.

speaker: Alice
text: Why?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, it's hard to explain.

speaker: Alice
text: Why?

speaker: Roz
text: It's complicated.

speaker: Alice
text: Why?

speaker: Roz
text: Mommy works in an office and Roger works in a truck.  And people in offices and people in trucks... it's complicated.

speaker: Alice
text: I like Roger.

speaker: Roz
text: I know, honey.

speaker: Alice
text: Do you like Roger?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, but...

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Alice
text: Okay...

speaker: Roz
text: Okay.  Sarah, can you look after Alice?  I'll be right back. _She sets Alice down and heads out the door.  CUT TO: the outside of her apartment building._

speaker: Roz
text: Roger!

speaker: Roger
text: Hi.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm so sorry that I've been such an idiot.  I don't know what's wrong with me.  All I know is that I miss you like crazy.  Do you still have an opening for a Mole Queen?

speaker: Roger
text: You sure? _She climbs on the back of the truck and kisses him.  The truck pulls down the alley to the next stop.  Roger gets down to grab the cans, Roz helps him.  FADE OUT._
